DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate effect two different technique ( dry needle Strain-counterstrain manual technique ) upper trapezius myofascial trigger point ( MTP ) . Subjects active latent MTP location muscle identify randomly assign one three group : dry needling , strain-counterstrain placebo manual technique . Pain pressure threshold , provoke pain , pain rest , neck disability electromyography ( EMG ) activity upper trapezius register six session treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Dry Needling Versus Strain-counterstrain Upper Trapezius
DOC.criteria: Active myofascial trigger point upper trapezius Diagnosed fibromyalgia Cervical radiculopathy Facial neuralgia Coagulation alteration Cancer Allergy ( included needle ) History cervical shoulder surgery History deep venous thrombosis History myopathy History infiltration upper trapezius trigger point Anticoagulant medication Aspirin intake last 3 day Drug intake ( AINES , narcotic , antiepileptic , analgesic medication ) Pregnancy
